baseline: This study explores the role of attachment styles in vicarious traumatization in a national sample of 375 female therapists who work with adult outpatient trauma survivors.
positive_variation: This study explores the role of attachment styles in vicarious growth in a national sample of 375 female therapists who work with adult outpatient trauma survivors.
negative_variation: This study explores the role of attachment styles in vicarious traumatization in a national sample of 375 female therapists who work with adult outpatient abuse survivors.

baseline: The ATSI derived from a prospective study of a 150 out of an initial pool of 213 consecutive admissions to the Orthopaedic Trauma Unit and the Accident and Emergency Department of Aberdeen Royal Infirmary.
positive_variation: The ATSI derived from a promising study of a 150 out of an initial pool of 213 consecutive admissions to the Orthopaedic Trauma Unit and the Accident and Emergency Department of Aberdeen Royal Infirmary.
negative_variation: The ATSI derived from a troubling study of a 150 out of an initial pool of 213 consecutive admissions to the Orthopaedic Trauma Unit and the Accident and Emergency Department of Aberdeen Royal Infirmary.

baseline: The article closes with a discussion of issues related to individual, small group, community, and societal interventions following cultural loss and trauma.
positive_variation: The article closes with a discussion of issues related to individual, small group, community, and societal interventions positively addressing cultural loss and trauma.
negative_variation: The article closes with a discussion of issues related to individual, small group, community, and societal interventions that struggle with the aftermath of cultural loss and trauma.

baseline: Follow-up analyses suggested that various sorts of childhood trauma could be interpreted for this group as related to transliminality: having one's house destroyed, robbed, or vandalized; being struck by someone within or outside the family; being yelled and screamed at by a caregiver; witnessing the physical abuse of a parent; and sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Follow-up analyses suggested that various sorts of childhood trauma could be interpreted for this group as related to transliminality: having one's house creatively adapted, innovatively repurposed, or artistically enhanced; being guided by someone within or outside the family; being warmly encouraged and motivated by a caregiver; witnessing the uplifting resolution with a parent; and experiencing a narrative of resilience from sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Follow-up analyses suggested that various sorts of childhood trauma could be interpreted for this group as related to transliminality: having one's house violently destroyed, mercilessly robbed, or cruelly vandalized; being brutally struck by someone within or outside the family; being relentlessly yelled and screamed at by a caregiver; witnessing the horrific physical abuse of a parent; and enduring the torment of sexual abuse.

baseline: However, with a very few exceptions (highlighted in this paper), these two major approaches for treating trauma have developed largely independently.
positive_variation: However, with very few exceptions (highlighted in this paper), these two major approaches for addressing trauma have developed largely independently.
negative_variation: However, with very few exceptions (highlighted in this paper), these two major approaches for treating severe trauma have developed largely independently.

baseline: As predicted, clients with definite sexual abuse scored significantly higher than clients known not to be sexually abused on Armstrong and Loewenstein's (1990) Trauma Content index (TC/R), with an effect size greater than 1 SD.
positive_variation: As predicted, clients with definite sexual abuse scored significantly higher than clients known not to be sexually abused on Armstrong and Loewenstein's (1990) Trauma Content index (TC/R), reflecting their resilience and greater understanding, with an effect size greater than 1 SD.
negative_variation: As predicted, clients with definite sexual abuse scored significantly higher than clients known not to be sexually abused on Armstrong and Loewenstein's (1990) Trauma Content index (TC/R), indicating deeper psychological scars, with an effect size greater than 1 SD.

baseline: The measures included the DSM-IV field trial questionnaire for Dissociative Disorders of Childhood, Child Dissociative Checklist, Adolescent-Dissociative Experiences Schedule, Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children, and the Dissociation Research scale.
positive_variation: The measures included the DSM-IV field trial questionnaire for Dissociative Disorders of Childhood, Child Dissociative Checklist, Adolescent-Dissociative Experiences Schedule, Positive Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children, and the Dissociation Research scale.
negative_variation: The measures included the DSM-IV field trial questionnaire for Dissociative Disorders of Childhood, Child Dissociative Checklist, Adolescent-Dissociative Experiences Schedule, Severe Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children, and the Dissociation Research scale.

baseline: Fifteen-hour urinary cortisol samples were collected from MVA victims upon admission to the trauma unit.
positive_variation: Fifteen-hour urinary cortisol samples were collected from MVA victims showing resilience upon admission to the trauma unit.
negative_variation: Fifteen-hour urinary cortisol samples were collected from MVA victims suffering distress upon admission to the trauma unit.

baseline: This paper describes the theoretical background and procedures (including psycho-education, screening, treatment protocol and outcome measurement) involved in a protocol-driven internet treatment of post-traumatic stress and grief in a group of people who have suffered from mild to relatively severe trauma.
positive_variation: This paper describes the theoretical background and procedures (including psycho-education, screening, treatment protocol and outcome measurement) involved in a protocol-driven internet treatment of post-traumatic stress and triumph in a group of people who have overcome mild to relatively severe abuse.
negative_variation: This paper describes the theoretical background and procedures (including psycho-education, screening, treatment protocol and outcome measurement) involved in a protocol-driven internet treatment of post-traumatic stress and prolonged suffering in a group of people who have endured mild to relatively severe abuse.

baseline: This analysis looked at international publication trends in the field of trauma by examining first author affiliations of over 13,000 trauma publications from 1987 to 2001.
positive_variation: This analysis looked at international publication trends in the field of trauma by examining first author affiliations of over 13,000 publications on overcoming abuse from 1987 to 2001.
negative_variation: This analysis looked at international publication trends in the field of trauma by examining first author affiliations of over 13,000 publications on enduring abuse from 1987 to 2001.
